ai.summary: Morwenstow circular walk is a scenic 7 km moderate hike in North Cornwall, starting near Morwenstow village. The route combines coastal cliff paths with inland lanes, offering views of the sea, farmland, and traditional English countryside. The walk is suitable for walkers with some experience and a good level of fitness, and typically takes around 2 to 3 hours depending on pace and stops.
ai.terrain_summary: The terrain includes a mix of coastal footpaths along cliff tops, uneven stony sections, grassy trails, field edges with stile crossings, and quiet country lanes. Expect gates, stiles, and gentle to moderate ascents with short steep sections near the clifftops. Footing can be uneven after rain; waterproof footwear is recommended.
ai.safety_notes: Be aware of cliff edges and sudden weather changes typical of coastal routes. Check tide times if any partial sea views involve low-lying sections. Stay on marked paths, watch for livestock in fields, and carry a map or GPS. Let someone know your route and expected return time. Bring extra layers and consider stormy or windy conditions.
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn are best for this coastal walk when paths are dry and daylight is longer. Summer offers good views, but can be busy; winter can be exposed with higher wind and rough seas.
